abstract: The anticipated offer, worth about $60 a share, is a 60 percent premium to Airgas’s closing price Thursday.
snippet: The anticipated offer, worth about $60 a share, is a 60 percent premium to Airgas’s closing price Thursday.
lead_paragraph: Air Products and Chemicals, a producer of industrial gases, has made an unsolicited $5.1 billion offer for a rival, Airgas, after having been rebuffed for months, people briefed on the matter said Thursday.

headline.main: Air Products Said to Offer $5.1 Billion for Its Rival Airgas
headline.print_headline: Air Products Said to Offer $5.1 Billion for Its Rival Airgas

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase received roughly $10 million worth of shares in the bank he runs after exercising expiring 10-year-old stock options, according to regulatory filings.
snippet: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase received roughly $10 million worth of shares in the bank he runs after exercising expiring 10-year-old stock options, according to regulatory filings.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, received roughly $10 million worth of shares in the bank he runs after exercising expiring 10-year-old stock options, according to regulatory filings.

headline.main: Dimon Gets $10 Million in JPMorgan Shares

abstract: JPMorgan Chase’s Jamie Dimon pulled in a roughly $17 million bonus in restricted stock and options for 2009, making him one of the best-paid banking chiefs around.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase’s Jamie Dimon pulled in a roughly $17 million bonus in restricted stock and options for 2009, making him one of the best-paid banking chiefs around.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon can lay claim to the biggest bonus for a Wall Street chief for 2009 — so far.
